org.apache.juneau.serializer

Class SerializerSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Session
      • org.apache.juneau.serializer.SerializerSession
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JsonSerializerSession, MsgPackSerializerSession, RdfSerializerSession, UonSerializerSession, XmlSerializerSession

    public class SerializerSession
extends Session
    Context object that lives for the duration of a single use of Serializer.

    Used by serializers for the following purposes:

    • Keeping track of how deep it is in a model for indentation purposes.
    • Ensuring infinite loops don't occur by setting a limit on how deep to traverse a model.
    • Ensuring infinite loops don't occur from loops in the model (when detectRecursions is enabled.
    • Allowing serializer properties to be overridden on method calls.

    This class is NOT thread safe. It is meant to be discarded after one-time use.

    Author:
    James Bognar (james.bognar@salesforce.com)

    • Constructor Detail

      • SerializerSession

        public SerializerSession(SerializerContext ctx,
                         BeanContext beanContext,
                         Object output,
                         ObjectMap op,
                         Method javaMethod)
        Create a new session using properties specified in the context.
        Parameters:
        ctx - The context creating this session object. The context contains all the configuration settings for this object.
        beanContext - The bean context being used.
        output - The output object.
        Character-based serializers can handle the following output class types:
        • Writer
        • OutputStream - Output will be written as UTF-8 encoded stream.
        • File - Output will be written as system-default encoded stream.

        Stream-based serializers can handle the following output class types:
        • OutputStream
        • File
        op - The override properties. These override any context properties defined in the context.
        javaMethod - The java method that called this parser, usually the method in a REST servlet.

    • Method Detail

      • getOutputStream

        public OutputStream getOutputStream()
                             throws Exception
        Wraps the specified output object inside an output stream. Subclasses can override this method to implement their own specialized output streams.

        This method can be used if the output object is any of the following class types:

        • OutputStream
        • File
        Returns:
        The output object wrapped in an output stream.
        Throws:
        Exception - If object could not be converted to an output stream.

        • File - Output will be written as system-default encoded stream.

      • push

        public ClassMeta<?> push(String attrName,
                         Object o,
                         ClassMeta<?> eType)
                  throws SerializeException
        Push the specified object onto the stack.
        Parameters:
        attrName - The attribute name.
        o - The current object being serialized.
        eType - The expected class type.
        Returns:
        The ClassMeta of the object so that instanceof operations only need to be performed once (since they can be expensive).
        Throws:
        SerializeException - If recursion occurred.

      • willRecurse

        public boolean willRecurse(String attrName,
                           Object o,
                           ClassMeta<?> cm)
                    throws SerializeException
        Returns true if SerializerContext.SERIALIZER_detectRecursions is enabled, and the specified object is already higher up in the serialization chain.
        Parameters:
        attrName - The bean property attribute name, or some other identifier.
        o - The object to check for recursion.
        cm - The metadata on the object class.
        Returns:
        true if recursion detected.
        Throws:
        SerializeException - If recursion occurred.

        Returns true if the specified value should not be serialized.
        Parameters:
        cm - The class type of the object being serialized.
        attrName - The bean attribute name, or null if this isn't a bean attribute.
        value - The object being serialized.
        Returns:
        true if the specified value should not be serialized.
        Throws:
        SerializeException - If recursion occurred.
